result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward M Blau was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 7/15/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 8 days jail for non payment.
Sentence credit of 5 days were granted.  Time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward M Blau

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Edward M Blau in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
COSTS: $243.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 7/15/16.)
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be paid at $50.00 per month).
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
JAIL: 5 Day - Apply 5 Day Credit - TIME SERVED.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 31, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Edward M Blau in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Weitzner advises the Court that the State is planning to appeal the Courts decision on the underlying charge. Attorney Weizner requests additional time to discuss the case with his client.  The Court sets the matter for trial. BAIL MONEY TO BE REFUNDED TO POSTER.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Edward M Blau in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the matter to address the motion to dismiss filed by Attorney Weitzner on 11/9/15.  The Court grants the motion to supress and dismisses 15CT1401.  The Court sets 15CM2463 for a hearing to address status of the case.  Hearing scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Edward M Blau in court with attorney Cameron Weitzner.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court conducts the motion hearing on the motion  filed in case 15CT1401.  The court schedules the matter for a hearing on in about one month for the court to render a decision on the motion heard in 15CT1401.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Defendant allowed non collect phone call.

Defendant Edward M Blau in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
